rooms.Name: The center of town
rooms.Description:
You're standing in the center of a small town.  The streets are strangely
bare, though a few hardy shopkeepers have kept their businesses open.  A wise
old man stands next to the fountain here, ready to help those who are in need
of information.  You can get anything you need from the friendly people of
this town, for the right price.  The sky is blue and cloudless, yet there is
an unnatural gloom that has settled over this place.

rooms.Name: In front of the healer's home
rooms.Description:
You stand in front of a small home just to the south of the town center.
The house is simple, but has a real homey quality to it.  You can hear
the fountain in the town square gurgling, and birds fly high above you,
crying out in beautiful song.  Everything is serene and beautiful, and
it seems like anything is possible.

rooms.Name: In front of the tavern
rooms.Description:
You are standing in front of what was probably once a bustling tavern.  The
bar where dozens of people used to drink now sits empty.  Ogden still keeps
the place a clean as a whistle for the occasional customer.  He'll sell you a
drink or a bite to eat for a reasonable price.

rooms.Name: In front of the blacksmith's shop
rooms.Description:
You're standing in front of the town's smithy.  A large man stands before
you, his arms crossed.  As you look at his wares he keeps an eye on you, just
in case you become a little sticky fingered.  The forge burns hotly just a
few feet back in the building, and you start to sweat even from this
distance.

A big sign sits on the wall.  Read it for information about item repairs.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Welcome to the smithy. Here I can repair armor that has been damaged
by corrosion, or acid, or items which have durability. This is not an 
easy task, so it will not be cheap.

To get a price for fixing a piece of armor type Appraise item name. 
To have it repaired type Repair item name.

rooms.Name: Between the tavern and the healer's home
rooms.Description:
You are standing between two buildings.  Light pours out of the tavern
to the north, and you can hear birds singing from above Pepin's home
to the south.  A small path leads off to the northwest towards the bar
run by Gillian.  Loud music floats down from the bar, drawing your
attention.  Perhaps Gillian would like to talk for a while, she always
has some piece of gossip to pass around.

rooms.Name: A path between the rocks
rooms.Description:
This small path winds between huge boulders that jut out of the ground,
leading towards a bridge over a river to the west.  To the south a
fissure has opened up in the ground, and hot, noxious fumes waft up out
of it.  You can feel the presence of pure evil emanating from the crack
and you somehow know that it will lead you to hell itself.

rooms.Name: The entrance to hell
rooms.Description:
You have entered a large fissure in the ground.  The vapors rising up
out of it cloud your mind and make you dizzy.  The heat is oppressive,
making it even harder to breathe than it already is.  

You see a big sign here posted by MidKnight:

DO NOT GO INTO THIS PART OF DIABLO UNLESS YOU ARE PART OF A VERY VERY
LARGE GROUP OF LEVEL 100 CHARACTERS WHO ARE READY TO TAKE ON THE
HARDEST MOBS IN THE MUD.  ALL OTHERS SHOULD *TURN* *BACK* *NOW*!!!!

rooms.Name: Before the bridge
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the end of a small path.  To the east you can see a small
wooden bridge leading to the opposite shore.  A medium sized river runs
perpendicular to this path, and goes under the bridge to fall away to the
south.  There are large rocks all around, and across the river you can see
what looks like a cave.

rooms.Name: On the bridge
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a bridge overlooking a rushing river.  The water flows
under your feet and droplets splash up onto you.  The wood creaks as you walk
across and a sudden unconnected thought comes into your head.  You wonder if
there are trolls under the bridge, but no, this isn't a fairy tale.  Across
the river you can see an opening in the side of a rock which looks to be a
small cave.

rooms.Name: Beyond the bridge
rooms.Description:
To the west you see a large dark opening in the rocks, the mouth of a cave.
The path which ended on the other side of the bridge continues here, turning
to the north.  This place is riddled with boulders, but up to the north you
can see a tree rising above the rocks, with something small sitting under it.
From the mouth of the cave you can hear what sounds like moaning, but perhaps
it's just the wind.

rooms.Name: A small path
rooms.Description:
This small path winds in and around the rocks, turning left and right with
barely enough room for you to squeeze through.  Ahead you can see a large,
lone tree growing amid the rocks.  A small boy sits under its branches,
watching you as you approach.  The path begins to widen slightly as it nears
the small clearing under the tree.

rooms.Name: Under a small tree
rooms.Description:
A large tree grows here, standing high and proud, in defiance of the
barrenness of the surrounding land.  Its branches have long since lost their
leaves, yet it still seems majestic.  Sitting up against it is a small boy,
one of his legs replaced by a wooden stick.  Grass grows in this small
clearing in the rocks, not thickly but enough to soften the edges of the
rocks all around.

rooms.Name: The entrance to the caves
rooms.Description:
The wind whistles through the caves, making the room resonate with
what sounds like moans.  The cave goes into the rock for about twenty
feet and then turns sharply downward.  As you move in deeper, the
moaning sounds grow louder, and you're not entirely sure that they're
actually just the wind.  Agonized cries chill you to the bone, and
the howling of a thousand trapped souls fills you with fear.

A sign posted by MidKnight is here:

DO NOT ENTER THIS PLACE UNLESS YOU ARE AT LEAST LEVEL 90 WITH VERY
GOOD EQUIPMENT.  DANGER LIES AROUND EVERY TURN, AND THE SLIGHTEST
MISTAKE WILL MEAN YOUR DOOM.

rooms.Name: Between the blacksmith's shop and the tavern
rooms.Description:
A chill wind blows from the east, whipping your clothing about your body. You
get goosebumps for a minute and shiver.  The broad blue sky opens above you,
yet you get the feeling that it's all just an illusion.  The wind tells tales
no human would dare.  On the wind you can feel the true terror that runs
through the town.

rooms.Name: Behind the blacksmith's shop
rooms.Description:
The unending pounding from the blacksmith is finally muffled as you get
behind the building.  There's a small house to the north which seems to have
been abandonded by its owner.  The town square turns into a path that leads
east towards the river and west around the house and behind the tavern.

rooms.Name: Behind the tavern
rooms.Description:
A small house sits to the north of the tavern, across the path which is
quickly becoming a road.  Ruts from carts have shaped the road into two long
channels, though from the grass that is growing up along it, this road is not
travelled much anymore.  What used to be a busy trading route is now nothing
but a path for the wind to blow down.  The echoes of your footsteps off the
walls of the buildings around you seem hollow and empty.

rooms.Name: Along the river
rooms.Description:
You're walking along the river, a little ways off to the west you can see a
house, and this one seems to be occupied, unlike many of the others around
here.  There is a large field to the northwest and off in the distance you
can see a gazebo and cows grazing.  Up ahead is a small wooden bridge that
spans the river.

rooms.Name: In front of the bridge
rooms.Description:
The path here runs up to a small wooden bridge spanning the river.  You can
see a large field across the river, dotted with a couple trees.  To the
northeast you can see a small gazebo in a field full of cows.  The grass
spreads out lush and thick as your gaze leaves the confines of the town
proper.  A low rock wall surrounds the area, keeping the cows to their
grazing pasture.

rooms.Name: On the bridge
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a small wooden bridge.  The planks beneath your feet are
damp and slightly slippery from the spray of the river.  You gaze down the
length of the river and can envision days spent fishing from this very spot.
Poles made of simple sticks and string, sitting back and fishing not to catch
fish but just for the joy of sitting in the outdoors and talking.

rooms.Name: Beyond the bridge
rooms.Description:
You've crossed over the bridge and are now at the southern end of a large
field.  Trees dot the landscape, and the path continues to the northeast,
though it seems less travelled than before the bridge.  The grass is green
and untouched, left to grown naturally.  A breeze stirs the blades, creating
waves that ripple across the field.  The weeds and grass have begun to
encroach on the path, giving the area an earthy feel.

rooms.Name: A small field
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the middle of a large field.  The path you have been
following has all but peetered out, the grass growing over the dirt track.
Small animals scurry amidst the tall grass, and the wind cools your face as
it blows across the field.  Up ahead a ways, at the northern side of the
grassy field, you can see a small shack perched on a hill.

rooms.Name: Further in the field
rooms.Description:
You have reached the northern end of the field.  Up ahead is a small shack on
a low hill.  It seems to be run down, at first glance, but as you get closer,
you can see that there are flowers around the base of the structure, and the
area surrounding it is well taken care of.

rooms.Name: In front of the witch's shack
rooms.Description:
You are standing in front of a small run down shack.  It looks so run down,
it is hard to believe anyone actually lives there.  Adria does though, so it
is obviously not that bad.  The grass around here is lush and green, and the
shack does have a nice view of the river.  After the long walk from the town
proper, you can appreciate the privacy this woman has.

There is a sign sitting on the wall. Read it for info about recharging wands.

ExtraDescs.Description:
To recharge a wand, simple type Recharge <item name>.
It costs 1,800 gold per charge per level to recharge a wand or staff.

rooms.Name: A space between three buildings
rooms.Description:
You are on a small path just to the north of the town square.  The hustle and
bustle (what little there is) fades into the distance.  The dirt path goes
off to the east behind the smithy and continues west behind the tavern.  You
can see trees off to the northwest, as the town becomes more sparsely
populated.

rooms.Name: Between two buildings
rooms.Description:
To the north you can see Griswold's blacksmith shop, and to the south
is a small house.  The river is just a little ways off to the east, you
can hear the water rushing down and away from the town.  A path to the
east runs along the river, going behind the house and the smithy.

rooms.Name: By the river
rooms.Description:
You are walking along the banks of a good sized river.  A small path winds
along beside it, leading down in front of a small house to the south, and up
behind the smithy to the north.  Sounds of a hammer on an anvil echo down the
river, carried along with the water.  A fish jumps from the water to snap at
a fly.  The rush of the water is soothing and peaceful and makes you want to
sit down to an impromptu picnic.

rooms.Name: Behind a building
rooms.Description:
The river to the east runs down and away from the town to some sea far away.
A small, run down house sits to your east, looking all but abandoned.  The
paint on the shingles has long ago peeled off, leaving the wood bare to the
elements.  A window in the attic is broken, and as run down as it is, it
seems someone does live here, as smoke curls up lazily from the chimney.

rooms.Name: A small nook beside the building
rooms.Description:
A small space between the old house and the rocks to the south is filled by a
small tree and the withered form of a man past his prime. The tree looks well
cared for, though the terrain makes it hard to flourish.  The branches scrape
against the side of the house, and the lack of paint on the shingles tell of
time now lost.  The shadows grow long and fortell of a darker time ahead.

rooms.Name: Between the blacksmith's shop and the river
rooms.Description:
The heat from the smithy and the cool spray from the river compete for
dominance as this small path skirts between them.  The back of the smithy is
grey with the spray of water from the river, as the water crashes against the
rocks along its banks.  The rush of the water and pounding of the hammer on
the anvil war against each other, each trying to drown out the other.

rooms.Name: Next to the river
rooms.Description:
You have reached an intersection in the path.  You can go south behind the
blacksmith shop, or west towards the center of town, or north along the
river.  Up ahead you can see a bridge spanning the river, and there's a small
house off to the northeast.

rooms.Name: A small path leading away from town
rooms.Description:
You're walking on a small path that terminates up ahead.  It seems to go
towards the field and then just end at the edge of the house to the left.
The house is one of the few you've seen occupied.  Smoke billows out of the
chimney and the sounds of dinner being made inside cause your stomach to
grumble.  Up ahead you can see a large field, and at the other end of it, a
small gazebo.

rooms.Name: In front of the bar
rooms.Description:
loud music assaults your ears from inside the bar.  Gillian stands at
the swinging doors, ready to greet all those who would patronize her
establishment.  Though the player piano is playing up a storm and smoke
wafts out of the doorway, when you look inside you see only a few old
men trying to drown their problems in their cups.  Perhaps things
aren't as good as they seem.

rooms.Name: A large field
rooms.Description:
You are at the southern end of a large field to the north of town. Cows graze
on the grass all around you, and if you poke them, they moo at you.   The
grass is green and lush, cut low from the cows' grazing. Up ahead to the
north is a small white gazebo and off to the west is an old church surrounded
by a small cemetary.  A stone wall surrounds this field and cordons off the
cemetary, but there's a portion that's since crumbled and you could make it
over the wall there.

rooms.Name: In the middle of a large field
rooms.Description:
Grass surrounds you for yards and yards on all sides.  Cows are milling
around the area minding their own business and grazing.  A low stone wall
fences the field in on two sides, with the town on the south and the river on
the east side.  There are a couple trees here, and you suddenly feel like
rolling around in the grass for no other reason than because you can. A small
white gazebo is off to the northwest, it looks like it's worth looking into.

rooms.Name: In front of a small gazebo
rooms.Description:
You are standing in front of a small white gazebo.  It looks like it was once
a place where young lovers could go to be alone, or a site for town fairs to
take place.  A slight breeze blows through the  latticework, and you feel a
chill run down your spine.  This is supposed to be a quiet haven from the
rigors of every day life, yet you feel a sense of forboding.  Looking inside
the gazebo you notice the floor has been ripped out and beneath it is a deep
hole, travelling into the bowels of the earth.

rooms.Name: The entrance to the catacombs
rooms.Description:
The inside of the gazebo has been ripped out, a large hole in the floor runs
down below ground and you can feel the warm musty air waft up out of it.
There is a feeling of evilness and dread coming from below, and you all but
turn away in fear.  Whatever is down there is evil beyond compare and not
something you want to deal with on your own.

MidKnight has posted a sign here:

WARNING:  THIS PLACE IS FOR LEVELS 40-60.  IF YOU ARE LOWER THAN THAT DO NOT
COME HERE.  THERE ARE AGGRESSIVE MOBS IN THIS ZONE, PROCEED WITH CAUTION.

rooms.Name: The rear of the cemetary
rooms.Description:
You are in the rear of a small cemetary.  The headstones of dozens of people
lie broken on the ground.  Claw marks mar the surfaces of the polished
granite.  Whatever did this had no respect for the dead, and no fear of the
living.  The townsfolk must be really scared of this place if they dare not
come even to restore the graves of their relatives and friends.

rooms.Name: A small road
rooms.Description:
After turning the corner in the road you find yourself walking along next to
one of the few occupied houses you've seen around here.  There is a light on
inside and you can see smoke rising from the chimney. The smell coming from
inside is heavenly, almost makes you want to turn around and ask if they have
any extra.  But the thrill of adventure draws you ever onward, toward glory
and fame.

rooms.Name: On the road
rooms.Description:
The road passes north out of town, and splits east and west just ahead.
Beyond the intersection is a low stone wall which follows the road closely.
There is a small grove of trees off to the west and you can see an old church
to the northwest.  You can see a gathering of large rocks far to the south.
The road travels onward, pulling you towards your destiny.

rooms.Name: A T intersection
rooms.Description:
The road splits here, going west towards the church you saw before, and
heading east towards a large field.  A stone wall stops passage north, but
you can see over it into the area surrounding the church.  A small cemetary
sits between the wall and the church, though from the overturned gravestones
it must not be tended often.

rooms.Name: Behind a small house
rooms.Description:
You are at the corner of a stone wall that turns north here and heads of to
the west, parallel to this road.  There is a large field to the northeast,
and inside the stone wall you can see a small church.  The house to the south
seems warm and cozy, yet the sense of adventure that brought you here, drives
you onward.

rooms.Name: Along a stone wall
rooms.Description:
The road runs along the stone wall for another dozen yards or so and up ahead
you can see it turns into a break in the wall, angling north to the entrance
to a small church.  The trees around it are leafless and dying, whether from
neglect or the pure defilement you feel oozing from the place, you cannot
tell.  The warm friendly town beckons you back, and a voice echoes in the
back of your mind, warning you against going any further.

rooms.Name: A break in the stone wall
rooms.Description:
The road turns north here, going inside the stone wall.  A small church sits
inside the wall, strangely silent.  You notice the overgrown grass all around
the building, and overturned tombstones scattered about.  You approach the
courtyard of the place with a sense of dread.  There is evil here and it
takes every ounce of your courage to keep from turning around and running
away.

rooms.Name: In front of a large abandoned church
rooms.Description:
You are standing in front of what probably used to be a church frequented by
the people of the town.  The windows are broken and the doors are off their
hinges.  The outside hasn't been painted in ages, and the cemetary off to the
east is terribly run down.  You can feel an evil presence in this place, a
tingling that sets your hairs on end.  There's something wrong here,
something awfully, dangerously wrong.

rooms.Name: Inside the church, to the dungeons
rooms.Description:
You walk into the church and all of a sudden you can feel the evil of the
place pressing in around you.  There is a large pair of steps leading down
into the ground, and you can hear wails and moans from below.  The church has
been ripped to shreds, pews overturned and windows smashed.  It's a wonder it
still stands up.  You feel fear rise in your throat as you start down the
steps into the unknown.

rooms.Name: A small, ruined cemerary
rooms.Description:
As you walk around the side of the church you can see dozens of headstones
that have been knocked over or hacked apart.  Not one was left untouched.
Cracked and shattered pieces of tombstones lie scattered across the ground,
pieces of words staring up at you.  Dates and names all jumbled together now,
last words and eternal quotes mixed into one huge jigsaw puzzle.

rooms.Name: Stairs down to the dungeons
rooms.Description:
The steps down to the underground are covered in dirt and grime.  The air is
stale and musty, as if it hasn't been disturbed in centuries.  The stone of
the walls around you seems to close in around you as you walker deeper and
deeper into the ground.  You see the bones of someone who didn't quite make
it out, one fleshless hand stretched out towards the light trickling down
from above.  As you descend further, it becomes darker and more frightening.

You see a sign posted by MidKnight:

This level of Diablo is suitable for those people of levels 15-30.  There are
some harder mobs in here, and if you're not careful they could kill you.
Almost all are aggressive, though not extremely so.  Be careful, and fame and
fortune could be yours.

rooms.Name: Stairs down to the catacombs
rooms.Description: This area is not yet finished, come back later and it will be.

rooms.Name: Stairs down to the caves
rooms.Description:
This area is not quite done yet.  I'll let you know when you can
come here to die.

rooms.Name: Stairs down to hell
rooms.Description:
This level is still being worked on, please come back later and
it will be ready for you to die in.

rooms.Name: A utility room for silent mob progs
